fields.description: I'm trying to clone SVN repository to Git and on attempt to select the author mapping file, I noticed the button in "Advanced options" -> "Author Map File" launches "Open Folder" dialog, instead of "Open File".
fields.summary: git-svn Author Map File opens folder dialog
Add a checkbox in the Stash dialog, equivalent to --include-untracked

fields.description:
Hi there, since one of the major visited screens of Sourcetree is the "Commit" screen,, it makes sense that we have a hot key for the Commit button.

Every time I type in my commit message, I need to then take my hands off the keyboard, and use my mouse to press the commit button.  Having an assignable hotkey would be idea, otherwise, a control-shift-c option would REALLY all us power users to use your software MUCH more efficiently.  Would love if you could implement this 
Thanks!
fields.summary: Hotkey for Commit screen

fields.description: When you uninstall/reinstall SourceTree, it does remember the settings for bitbucket/stash/github, but not the global username/email for SourceTree itself.
fields.summary: Reinstall does not remember the setup values for username and email.

fields.description:
In previous versions, SourceTree allowed you to select external pre-configured or manual diff/merge settings.

ST 1.4.1 does not allow you to change these selections from "System Default" as the comboboxes are disabled (gray).
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.4.1.0 does not allow me to select any external diff/merge tool
Add "use rebase instead of merge by default" option for each individual GIT repository

fields.description:
Just messing around with GIT and your app, when cloning a fresh (small, testing) repo, opening its tab and (by chance) double-clicking Branches (the small triangle) to show/hide the sub-tree of branches (only one branche in my case) during loading of the branches, it threw the attached exception (I allowed myself to delete other records in the log, since they were caused by me deliberately, all were handled correctly by your app and had nothing to do with this fail).
I was able to reproduce the error somehow once more (this times the gui work of loading the branches UI was allready done and it was showing the Branches content, when I threw it down by duble clicking the small "Branches" triangle), but since then it was impossible for me to find out under which conditions this happens.
With the repo for the rest of the time the App works fine and stable.

Sorry for the vague description, but I really tried hard to reproduce this bug the 3rd times, clicking around the FileStatus/Branches/Tags/Remotes tree in the UI like a mad beast, but had no luck. But since your app pleadged so nicely for submitting the bug, so I did it. Maybe just a correctly placed if (some_instance != null) should solve it :-)
fields.summary: Failed switch in "Branches"

fields.description:
I have a feature branch created with git flow (inside SourceTree) that contains accents ("coleções"). Though I had no issue creating this feature branch, now I'm not allowed to finish it. When I try to finish the feature I get this:
{noformat}
sh.exe C:\Users\AAA\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow feature finish coleções
No branch matches prefix 'cole��es'

Completed with errors, see above.
{noformat}

Looks like an encoding error in the git-flow scripts (error message is in file gitflow-common, line 226).
fields.summary: git flow: branches with accents

fields.description: Mistake in 'update' translation. Not 'обноивть' but 'обновить'.
fields.summary: Wrong tranlation

fields.description:
With a repository selected, I go to Actions > Apply Patch > ... (choose file) > [browsing to and selecting a .patch file on disk] > Click Open > BOOM!

So in other words: SourceTree crashed when trying to select the patch file to apply. It happens with different patch files, so it is not just one that is corrupt. And I also manage to apply the patch properly using the hg command line.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when trying to apply patch

fields.description: Sometimes when you do a commit you get the difference of a file and what to copy information to the commit message. it would be great to be able to copy a line or part of a code line
fields.summary: Right Click in code diff window and copy some text

fields.description:
Currently sourcetree tries to connect over and over again asking for the user password if the ssh key for a git repository is not loaded in pageant, even when I press cancel it asks again for the user password.
This leads to problems if the server is protected e.g. with fail2ban
fields.summary: Fail when ssh-key for git-repository is not loaded

fields.description:
The screen to create a new project contains two localization errors in german:

"Ropository klonen / hinzufügen / erstellen" -> Repository

"Neues Reopository erstellen" -> Repository
fields.summary: Wrong german localization: Ropository

fields.description:
Hi,
I'd like to suggest two enhancements for sourcetree for windows

1. <search> functionality in git history

Very often I need to retrieve something I have done in the past whether by commit id, or simple keywords. Sourcetree doesn't provide this functionality and I believe this is a loss because it would be a very very simple and powerful tool to have. A simple textbox search box at the top right corner of the <log/history> tab would do.
a. Search by commit id
b. Search by keyword
c. Search by author

2. <search text> functionality in blame and file log

When I go in blame or file log, very often, it is to look at a specific class method change. If the file I'm looking at is really big, it can take a little while to find what I'm looking for. So having also a search box would be a very convenient tool to have.

This suggestions are not product essential I agree, but these little tools is what makes the difference between a frustrating and nice use experience.

And to finish on a good note, I've been evaluating the sourcetree software for a few months now and find it really powerful. Not necessarily intuitive in every aspects, but powerful and flexible enough to make a really good tool for git. Congratulations.

Regards,
Julien
fields.summary: <search> in git history / <search text> in blame and file log.

fields.description:
From SRCTREEWIN-46:

The latest update made this possible, there are quite some odd things about it though.

If you Ctrl-click two commits in the Log / History window, you cannot Rightclick > Patch.
Instead, you'll have to go to Actions > Create Patch (as listed in release notes).

But when you do this, only one of the selected commits is highlighted for patch-creating.
Ok, so you select the second commit as well. Now it will say "Displaying all changes between x and y", seems good right?
At first I didn't see the path for the patch file. So when clicking "Create Patch" I expected a popup window to ask me where to save it.

After I found the patch.diff in the root directory of the repository, it only listed one change to one file.
I went back to the Create Patch window and found out you had to highlight all the changesets you wanted included in the patch.
Okay, Ctrl-A works in this field so let's generate the patch again.

And now here's a bug. For some reason *only* the changesets of the first and last commit I selected are included in the patch.
Funny thing is that the first selected commit is actually not displayed in the patch changesets window (since it calculates the *difference* between the changesets x and y).
fields.summary: Create patch from log with multi-select incorrect behaviour

fields.description: If I have done some work and want to do commit this work with more than one commit it would be usefule if the "Commit-Window" would stay open if there are files in the "Working Copy Changes" section.
fields.summary: Leave Commit window open if after commit there are files in the "Working Copy Changes"

fields.description:
It would be a nice usability improvement if the Pull dialog used a radio-button rather than check-boxes when choosing between a Merge and Rebase.

Also, the first 3 check-boxes only make sense for a Merge, so maybe separate them out or disable them when a Merge is selected
fields.summary: The Pull dialog should use a Radio-button when choosing Merge or Rebase

fields.description:
When I try to launch SourceTree it fails to launch and this exception is logged in event viewer:

Application: SourceTree.exe
Framework Version: v4.0.30319
Description: The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.
Exception Info: System.Windows.Markup.XamlParseException
Stack:
   at System.Windows.Markup.WpfXamlLoader.Load(System.Xaml.XamlReader, System.Xaml.IXamlObjectWriterFactory, Boolean, System.Object, System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriterSettings, System.Uri)
   at System.Windows.Markup.WpfXamlLoader.LoadBaml(System.Xaml.XamlReader, Boolean, System.Object, System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlAccessLevel, System.Uri)

   at System.Windows.Application.LoadComponent(System.Object, System.Uri)

fields.summary: SourceTree fails to start raising an XamlParseException

fields.description: It is very inconvenient to catch "Stage File" button every time when you make a lot of files staging in file-by-file manner. Every file has different left docked header in stage panel and buttons "Stage..." and "Discard..." danced randomly from left to right when staging next file. Please dock this buttons to right side of the panel.
fields.summary: "Stage File" and "Discard File" buttons float - usability bug

fields.description:
Merging branches with 50+ commits on each branch is tedious, hard and painful no matter what tool you you use.

Having context of what introduced certain changes helps a lot in understanding  on what to do with complex conflicts.

My first problem is that when I launch the external conflict resolve tool, the entire ST program locks up until abort or the external tool exits. This forces me to use an alternate Hg software to dig up the history.

Second, my request is that when launching the external merge tool, automatically two windows should be launched showing the commit history in each branch. Just as shown in the attached picture.

Ideally, ST would remember the positioning of each window, so that every time I move on to the next file, the log windows maintain their layout (which is very useful for those using multi monitor setups + Windows' advanced window positioning system)

Additionally, the per-file log history is missing:
 * A column telling which branch the commit is from.
 * A dropdown menu to filter to a particular branch

The attached png was composited in GIMP (The merge tool is showing a different file though, it should be showing the same file in all 3 windows, you get the idea).

Something like this would greatly enhance the merging experience.

Thank you!
Matias
fields.summary: Improve branch merging by launching 2 log histories of the file alongisde the resolve conflict tool

fields.description:
Adding 2 new files:
Name.xaml
Name.xaml.cs
results in a wrong icon being displayed in the stagin area control.

It should be new file instead of rename.

See screenshot.
fields.summary: Rename icon instead of new file on stage area

fields.description:
After typing in SVN server address I get authenticated.
The SVN REPO is not recognized as a velid repo.
In advanced message window you can read that it "Can't open perl script 'C:\Program'.
See screen shot.
fields.summary: Unable to clone new svn repo

fields.description: We have commit links which are used in all repositories, so it would be great to have the opportunity to either define global commit text links or to be able to export/import them easily.
fields.summary: Global commit text links

fields.description: If you discard a hunk the preview diff doesn't reload. After change to another file and back the right result is shown.
fields.summary: Discard a hunk doesn't reload diff

fields.description:
On a windows 8.1 machine SourceTree stopped showing files that have been modified after updating to the 4.1.0.0
GitHub for Windows and the Git console both show the modified in the branch correctly
fields.summary: SourceTree does not show files that have changed

fields.description:
I was trying to guess keyboard shortcuts (see previous feature request issue: #1434 ) and found a keyboard shortcut that crashed the application.

Steps to reproduce:
Open SourceTree
Press CTRL + N  (for Clone/New)
Press SHIFT + Tab
Press SHIFT + Tab  (again)
App crashes

Screenshot and log included.
fields.summary: Keyboard combination crashes app

fields.description: Would be nice to have more keyboard shortcuts for some operations as creating new repository.  I know that you can use CTRL + N, but then I have to use the mouse to hit the New Repository tab.  This is a common theme in SourceTree, where I can get to the sub window with a keyboard shortcut, but then there are no shortcuts in those windows.
fields.summary: More Keyboard Shortcuts

fields.description:
Crash while creating patch; Selected multiple commit points from the working branch and enabled the create separate patch files for each commit option. 

Manually modified the patch path to a non-existent sub-directory expecting the new sub-directory to be created automatically.
(e.g. From /c/_projectDir/patch.diff to /c/_projectDir/_patches/patch.diff )

I highly suspect the crash was from the use of the non-existent sub-directory.
fields.summary: Crash when creating patch for multiple commits w/ individual patch file option enabled

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce.
1. File -> Clone / New...
2. Enter the URL of a subversion repository
    * I've tried a WebDAV + Apache Subversion system and a VisualSVN Server

3. Enter a Username and Password when prompted
4. SourceTree reports: "This is not a valid source path / URL"
5. Clicking Details... displays this error:
    Can't open perl script "C:\Program": No such file or directory
    fatal: respository 'http://<snip>/svn/<snip>' not found.
fields.summary: Cloning a Subversion [git-svn] repository results in parse error

fields.description: If I try to clone an svn repository (tried with embedded git version and latest system git version), I got a message that the URI is not valid (see screenshot) and if I click the detail button I got the message (see second screenshot) that the pearl script couldn't be executed.
fields.summary: Clone of SVN Repositories fail

fields.description: I use the command line as my primary means of using git.  There are some instances where I use SourceTree and it always prompts for my ssh passphrase and starts another instance of the ssh-agent.  This seems unnecessary and slows flow down especially when launching from the cli.
fields.summary: Check to see if SSH-Agent is already running

fields.description:
Command line switch -f with no args or .\ should open the repo in the current directory with the repo name as the bookmark name.  So that when in the command line (posh-git in my case) in a directory with a repo name of my-repo then calling 
& "C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\SourceTree.exe" -f .\
should result in SourceTree opening with a ready-made bookmark called my-repo pointed to that repo.

Currently there is some unnessessary dialogs and clicking and the default bookmark name is blank
fields.summary: Better defaults for the -f command line switch

fields.description: When selecting a commit, I can only view the affected files for that commit.  It would be extremely useful (and the only thing keeping me from switching from Git Extensions), to be able to select a commit and view the state of any file at that particular commit, regardless if it changed during that commit.
fields.summary: Browse all file state at any commit

fields.description:
Pretty much every word in my commit messages is being marked as incorrect. My language in SourceTree is set to English, I didn't see another setting for the spelling dictionary.

From the suggestions I would assume it thinks I want Norwegian spell checking or something.
fields.summary: Wrong spell check dictionary is being used

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# init repository
# init hg flow
# start new feature
# set branch name containing '#' symbol, e.g. 'id #12'
# finish feature

Expected result: can finish feature
Actual result: "Feature Name:" field is empty and grayed out, "OK" button is disabled.

The reason is in {{SourceTree.Repo.RepoHandlerHg.GetFlowList(...)}} method: regular expression prohibits the use of '#' symbol in the branch name.
fields.summary: hg flow does not work for feature branches with '#' in the name

fields.description: I want to start source tree for windows but i only got "Oops!" window, and option to report bug. No info about why it could not start was given.
fields.summary: can not run source tree for windows

fields.description:
I have a commit that contain both renamed files and added files.
I only select a part of the files to be committed, including all the renamed files.
(see the image)

The resulting commit will not rename the renamed files but only add them, forcing me to do a second commit to remove their previous copy. Therefore, the renaming doesn't work in this case.

I rolledback and tried again several times with the same result.
In the end I did the commit in TortoiseHg (freshly upgraded) with no problem. I suspect that there might be a problem with the manual adding that SourceTree does.
fields.summary: Renamed files are only added

fields.description: I had used git.exe to clone a Subversion repository from a server on the local network, and I was still working on getting it set up, so I had not yet committed any new work to either repository (Git or Subversion) since then. I copied my Subversion working copy over the Git repository, so Git saw a few modified files and a bunch of untracked files (which in the Subversion working copy were ignored files), as well as all the unchanged files. I had the Git repository open in SourceTree, with the File Status tab displayed. I focused the Working Copy Changes pane, invoked Select All from the Edit menu, and then invoked Copy from the Edit menu. Then I switched to another application; SourceTree reported an error, and when I closed the dialog box, it shut down.
fields.summary: Crash on copying paths of multiple files in Working Copy Changes

fields.description:
SourceTree frequently crashes completely when I click on the "tags" arrow to show or hide tags. I'm not sure if there's a problem with the way I'm tagging things (maybe a reference to a remote tag fails?) or if it's internal to SourceTree.
I tend to avoid clicking on "Tags" because I realize that it will often crash the program entirely.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when clicking Tags

fields.description:
Usually when I work on a branch, my other remote-tracking branches are left unmodified. Invoking pull updates only current branch while all other branches are now behind their upstream branches.

It would be nice if pull/fetch buttons had an option to automatically fast-forward all remote tracking branches. Even better if it had all the functionality of [git-up|https://github.com/aanand/git-up].
fields.summary: Simplify working with branches - fast forward all tracking branches.

fields.description:
After about a month it seems like sourcetree forgets the password and keeps prompting for it. 
The only fix for this is to delete the token create a new one.
fields.summary: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) with GitHub in SourceTree loses PW after ~month

fields.description:
{May be a duplicate of [SRCTREE-1533|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1533])

I use git-flow, and don't push my feature branches.

To keep my merge problems under control, I like to rebase, continuously, my feature branches onto 'develop' as other features get finalised.

Currently, I have to do this by checking out the feature, then rebasing onto develop.

It would be nice if I could leave (say) 'develop' checked out, and then just right-click on a feature branch and say "rebase this branch onto 'develop'".

I'm fairly noob at git, so a possible answer to this issue is "You're doing it wrong', of course...

Thanks for your attention
fields.summary: Additional rebase mode for git-flow (and maybe others)

fields.description:
Using git on the command line, if I commit a change without setting {{user.name}} or {{user.email}}, it warns me saying something like _"Your name and email address were configured automatically based on your username and hostname."_

Source tree doesn't do this, it would be useful to have it as an option.

Reason: I connect to several different git servers (github, bitbucket etc) and so I deliberately don't have my {{user.name}} and {{user.email}} configured globally. I configure it for each new repo I clone. But, this means I often forget to set it before I start committing. If I was using git on the command line it would warn me, so it would be useful if sourcetree did too.
fields.summary: Warn if user.name and user.email are not set for git repository

fields.description:
I have two related branches A and B. When a file X (which existed in both branches) was removed in branch A and I merge A into B, then the file X is marked as conflict. When selecting the file in SourceTree the diff view is empty and it says that there are no modifications. There is no indication whatsoever that this file was removed in one of the branches.

If I open the git bash and do a git status I clearly see that the file was deleted and in which branch. So git knows about this. It would be nice if this information would also be visible in the SourceTree UI.

Additionally, when resolving the conflict by chosing "Resolve using theirs" (theirs being branch A where the file was originally deleted) the conflict is just cleared and the file disappears from the index. This has the effect that committing this merge does not delete the file but keeps it. I would have expected that chosing theirs would instead mark the file as to-be-removed (and shows it as this in the index) because it was removed in that branch.

So in order to handle deleted files correctly during a merge I currently have to run git status in parallel to identify deleted files and then manually click Remove in SourceTree instead of resolving/merging the conflict. This is very inconvenient and error prone.
fields.summary: Deleted files are not shown as removed during merge and don't get removed on resolve

fields.description:
We've got a documentation repository with .docx, .pdf and .odt files.
"git diff" and "git show" commands worked out of the box on the commandline for both pdf and docx. odt required extra configuration. (attached)
Using SourceTree these diffs aren't shown.
Interestingly enough, the diff's ARE shown for merge commits.
fields.summary: textconv diff not generated

Pull request fails with error

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false pull origin RAE_3_1
      0 [main] us 0 init_cheap: VirtualAlloc pointer is null, Win32 error 487

This is new; however, I can not say whether new STree or new Java , sorry ...

fields.description:
See https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/251376/hg-fetch-now-discards-source-information

It's possible to use {{-m}} command line option to supply own commit message.
fields.summary: Preserve source origin in commit message with fetch extension

fields.description: Takes anywhere from 5-30 seconds or longer to launch, seems to be getting worse as times goes on. This makes merging take much longer than it should, overall the whole GIT system seems to be sluggish
fields.summary: Launch External Merge Tool is very slow
In gitlfow in the stash, there is a prefix for the bugfix. SourceTree does not support this.

fields.description:
I want you to be able to select the ConEmu when you click the terminal on the toolbar

ConEmu

fields.description: I suggest the use of -v and --progress git parameters to see progress of long git operations such as a big pull, push or clone.
fields.summary: Support git -v --progress

fields.description:
I would like very much to have a global Jira setting that takes precedence for all repos.

We have several repos but only one Jira. Very tedious to set the same link for all repos and have to reset when/if i clone another copy somewhere else.
fields.summary: Jira integration, global setting.

fields.description:
Adding a "fail if not fast forward", a.k.a. the {{--ff-only}} option to the "pull" panel would be very useful.
Use case: get the latest commits from a remote, but leave your local repo intact and not take the "risk" to create a merge commit.
fields.summary: Add "fail if not fast forward" option when pulling

fields.description: Hello I have many projects and I often need to check the URL of a remote. In the mment i must open the edit dalog to get the iformation. It would be fine if a tooltip on a remote would show the URL.
fields.summary: Tooltip that shows the URL of a remote

fields.description: Switching tabs in Source tree between two repos crashed it.
fields.summary: Switching tabs between repos crashed SourceTree.

fields.description:
The _Stage File_ and _Discard File_ buttons in the diff pane move horizontally based on the length of that file path/name.  

When wanting to Stage a bunch of files, it would be nice to not have to move the mouse around based on the length of the file name.  I suggest always putting them right aligned or putting them to the left of the file path so they don't move.
fields.summary: Make "Stage File" button in consistent location

fields.description:
SourceTree occasionally does not allow stashing unstaged changes.

If such a situation occurs I have to either:
- stage changes
- restart the app
fields.summary: Sometimes not possible to stash unstaged changes

fields.description: see screen shot
fields.summary: uncommitted changes are not form the checkouted breach

fields.description: Just check the attached image
fields.summary: History markers are misplaced

fields.description: Using the Clone in Source Tree button in Bitbucket, I started a second clone.  Then SourceTree crashed.  After reopening, SourceTree seemed to have both repos available and intact.
fields.summary: Source tree crash - possibly on 2 clones at the same time

fields.description:
If you have a repository and create a new orphan branch (git checkout --orphan xxx) Sourcetree will stop showing all already existing graphs / commits within the Log / History view.
You will need to make your initial commit to this newlöy created branch to get Sourcetree showing all graphs again.
fields.summary: Orphan branches

fields.description:
Since the recent update, whenever I commit to my local Git repo, SourceTree's *Push* button does not show a *push indicator* in order to prompt me that I need to push to the Git remote.

Henceforth I am at risk of losing local code since it is not synced properly to the remote for others to use.
fields.summary: Push indicator does not reflect Git remote status

fields.description:
After system restart I have opened SourceTree and all my repositories are missing.

Left bar with bookmarks & repo folders is empty.

I had planty of repositories configured and now I have to do this again.
Is there any chance to restore config?
fields.summary: All bookmarks & repositories removed after update

fields.description:
if I have a lot of changed files the "Working copy changes" pane and the "Staged changes" lists would be very long. sometimes I have 100 files listed and I need to search for a specific file to see what has changed in it. 

my feature request is to add a filter option (as a button on the divider between the panes (near the arrows)). pressing the button will show a small floating textbox that I would be able to write something and the file lists on both panes will be filtered by that text
fields.summary: Add file searching capability

fields.description:
Including Git Flow is awesome, but would it be possible to use the Git Flow AVH fork (https://github.com/petervanderdoes/gitflow)?

The original Git Flow hasn't been updated in nearly a year now as where the AVH fork is constantly seeing new releases containing both fixes and features.

It functions exactly the same and should be a drop in replacement.
fields.summary: Switch to git-flow-avh

fields.description:
When Comodo's sand boxing feature is enabled it will prevent SourceTree from accessing GIT.  I'm using my own install of GIT instead of embedded, so maybe if I was using embedded this issue may not have shown.

I was confused what was going on, but my IDE which has GIT integration told me that GIT was inaccessible. 

It would be nice to have SourceTree do a similar check and show a warning message.
fields.summary: Needs error when GIT cannot be initialized

fields.description:
Afrer cloning a repository, it crashed.
Log attached
fields.summary: Crash

fields.description:
The app is very laggy, after the update it really takes a long time to refresh repo listings and changes. Pulling and pushing also seems like its hanging the app but then suddenly after about 30s or so it finishes. 

Please note this was not the case before I updated to v1.3.3 so it's quite workflow breaking if it lags like this.
fields.summary: Sourcetree very laggy

fields.description:
It seems minor, but honoring .mailmap in SourceTree-- already the best Git gui client out there-- would be a killer feature.  In my current organization and past organizations (Fortune 100 companies), we use subversion repos where the usernames are Company IDs which do not provide any clue as to the true identity of the user.  I use the git-svn bridge at work and enjoy the .mailmap functionality in git log, but miss it in SourceTree (along with every other Git Gui client I've tried).  

Implement this feature and I can guarantee everyone in my immediate group will be soon be using git-svn and SourceTree-- from there it's a short step to cut out the middleman and move to stash/git.
fields.summary: honor .mailmap

fields.description:
One of the very distracting things about using source tree is interacting with MQs. MQs is built in and allows one to shelve work in nice discrete chunks and allows easy sharing of patches while in development. (The MQ patches can be stored in their own HG repo that can be pulled by someone else)

I use MQs quite a bit. I have an earlier request for full MQ support in source tree. However, at the moment source tree can see MQ work and thinks they are simply specially tagged commits. thg (slow horrible) displays these items with a diamond instead of a circle in the change graph. It would be great if source tree could do something like this simply to avoid ambiguity.
fields.summary: MQ Graph View Request

fields.description:
Sometimes it can be slow to find uncommitted changes, maybe a manual refresh button could be of help? 

I also think that maybe having a paginated commit history would help load times.
fields.summary: Slow Loading

fields.description: In the Options -> Git  I checked "Do not fast-forward when merging, always create commit". If I finish a feature with GitFlow and the feature consist of one commit only, a fast-forward merge is done.
fields.summary: On finishing a feature (GitFlow) the "do not fast forward" preference is ignored if the feature contains only one commit.

fields.description:
As longtime Stash users, we are naturally thinking about using SourceTree on our developpers workstations (300+). We are currently provisioning all our dev tools (100+) on those machines using Puppet so that our developers spend their time on coding rather than configuring.

We are currenlty stuck with the SourceTree install automation. Even though we managed to make the installation work silently and into the desired folder, the product still needs some configuration (git.exe, email, Mercurial option, putty, license, etc.) upon first launch.
Would it be possible to specify those options during the installation process - or a file somewhere where we could set them post-install ?

Thanks,
Nicolas
fields.summary: Allow the installation to be fully automated

fields.description:
This was described as part of SRCTREEWIN-1373 (which should be reopened!) but it's really a separate issue.

It seems SourceTree keeps refreshing Working Copy Changes even when only ignored files change. This happens for example after refactoring with resharper in Visual Studio which triggers code analysis and probably updates some cache file which is ignored by git.

Blocking and emptying Working Copy Changes during refresh makes this particularly annoying - SourceTree is basically unusable for a few minutes each time resharper keeps analyzing something.
fields.summary: Status keeps refreshing when nothing is modified

fields.description: Although Mercurial supports amending the previous commit (hg commit --amend) there is no checkbox for amending in the SourceTree commit dialog for a Mercurial repository. The checkbox does appear for Git repositories, though.
fields.summary: Support for hg commit --amend

fields.description: It would be very handy if the search box allowed using wildcard search characters. ex: * or ? for multiple character / single character match respectively or I suppose you could support regular expressions but * or ? would be enough for me.
fields.summary: Wild card search

fields.description:
After creating a commit text link with regular expression which was not valid the application reported unexpected error and crashed. Log stacktrace reported problem with regexp evaluation.
After starting sourcetree again it opened commit, tried to apply regexp and failed again, so it was NOT possible to remove the regexp from commit text links settings. I had to search and edit config file where sourcetree saves commit text links.
the regexp included [a-Z] which caused the problem.
fields.summary: Commit text links - blocks application from running

fields.description:
Add the feature to manage Bitbucket Issues and Commits related to my remote repository, directly from the SourceTree for Window.

This way I won't need to open Bitbucket on my browser to comment/create an Issue or approve a Commit on my remote repository.

I faced this problem when a commit was made from SourceTree, and I had to open Bitbucket on my browser to approve it, and also to comment on an Issue.
fields.summary: Manage Bitbucket Issues and Commits directly from SourceTree

fields.description: Take a look at the new MonoDevelop for Windows. Great GUI, isn't it? Would be great to see the same in the SourceTree for Windows.
fields.summary: Better GUI

fields.description:
Currently the embedded version of git that comes with sourcetree is the only installation of git on my machine. It would be nice to be able to create a custom action that would execute some git commands against the embedded version of git as though I had clicked 'Terminal' and entered them myself. It would be even better if I could create a custom action that would allow me to execute a bash script in the 'Terminal'.

For example, if I wanted to be able to merge one commit onto all of my branches (say, if a fix needs to be applied to all versions of a product) currently I would have to install git, write a batch script that executes the git commands necessary, and then make a custom action that points to the batch script and passes $REPO and $SHA.
fields.summary: Allow Custom Actions to run git commands against the embedded copy of git

fields.description:
Right click on a branch
Click {{Merge <selected branch name> into current branch}}
The dialog has the option for "Create a new commit even if fast-forward is possible" (i.e. the {{--no-ff}} option).
It would also be useful to have a "Abort unless merge can be completed as a fast-forward" option (i.e. the {{-ff-only}} option).
fields.summary: Add --ff-only checkbox to merge dialog

fields.description:
We use Tectia SSH which has support for both smartcards and soft tokens, and is a company standard.

{code}
[C:\temp\ftp]set GIT_SSH
C:\PROGRA~2\SSHCOM~1\SSHTEC~1\SSHTEC~3\ssh2.exe
 
[C:\temp\ftp]git ls-remote ssh://git@host.domain.net:7999/ftp/ftp.git
53acf59f40cb1c3f07e5a4a602529f77fea73911        HEAD
53acf59f40cb1c3f07e5a4a602529f77fea73911        refs/heads/develop
d27bb53a2bf5de56c0d3e6436b610a41dc69e35f        refs/heads/feature/FTP-1-qq
...
{code}

However sourcetree doesn't seem to want to use it, it only allows plink or OpenSSH.

Could sourcetree respect the value of GIT_SSH (and possibly allow overriding it in the config)?
fields.summary: Support for alternative SSH clients

fields.description: It would be nice to have SourceTree able to use Tectia SSH Client: http://www.ssh.com/index.php/products/tectia-ssh-client.html
fields.summary: Tectia SSH Client Support

fields.description: When working copy status is refreshed (which happens periodically), selection in "Working Copy Changes" panel is discarded.
fields.summary: Status refresh discards selection

fields.description:
It seems like SourceTree periodically scans filesystem for changes to get updated status. Unfortunately it is as slow as standard `git status`.

On large repos this is VERY annoying.
Please use System.IO.FileSystemWatcher or similar to keep status up to date in an efficient manner.
fields.summary: Improve refresh speed

fields.description:
After a fresh install, the application runs and appears to function correctly but contains no icons. Uninstalling and re-installing doesn't resolve the issue. Installing to either the default location or a custom location doesn't resolve the issue. This appears to also happen with version 1.3.2.

I use version 1.3.3 of SourceTree on two other Window machines and a Mac and don't experience this issue so it's something unique about this environment. The other Windows machines are running the same version of Windows and have similar development tools installed so nothing is jumping out at me as obviously different/unique/wonky about this environment.

I've installed it as an admin user with UAC and was prompted for Administrator elevation during the install process. I also tried running the installer from the get go with Administrator privileges. Same result.

Is there a place to look to see if the icons were successfully installed? Are there libraries used on the icon loading that I could validate versions, etc?

I'm assuming it's a software conflict of some kind but there's a fair amount of software installed on this machine and I'm not sure where to begin. Determining if it's an installation problem or a runtime problem is probably a good place to start.
fields.summary: Application is missing all of its icons

fields.description:
Fired up SourceTree this morning, was notified a new version was available. I said to download and install now. Partway through an access violation error popped up and now the installer cannot be exited or closed by normal methods (meaning: none of the dialog buttons break out of the loop).

Closing SourceTree app itself has no effect on the installer error loop.

http://i.imgur.com/qAkqwWQ.png

[SEH_AV_READ_BADPTR] ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at address [0x009dd238]

*** Stack Trace (x86) ***

[0x009dd238]  -----
fields.summary: access violaiton when installing upgrade

fields.description:
When I try to clone a git repository from Bitbucket, Sourcetree opens a dialog box:

"""
Askpass.exe - This application could not be started.

This application requires one of the following versions of the .NET Framework:
v.4.0.30319

Do you want to install this .NET Framework version now?
"""

I click yes, then a web page opens and start the download of .NET Framework v4.5.1. When the download runs, it tells me that that version of .NET Framework is already installed.

I also searched version 4.0.30319 from the MS site and downloaded it, but when installing it also says that it is already installed.

Doesn't SourceTree work in windows 8.1 ?

Thanks
fields.summary: Can't clone repo - Askpass could not be started

fields.description:
I've installed SourceTree following all recommended steps, and I've typed my bitbucket account information in the Setup Wizard.

Every time I try to push changes a windows logon pops up with my user name and password already entered, but if just click ok the proccess fails with an authentication error. If I however enter the exact same password by hand in that prompt, it works ok.

I have also noted that the password filled in automatically seems shorter than my real password, but if I open the setup wizard the correct amount of characters appear there.

This makes me believe that the password is not being correctly saved internally.

I'm rather liking this software, but it is quite troublesome to have to re-type my password each time, so any help will be greatly appreciated.
fields.summary: Password for bitbucket not remembered properly?
SourceTree cannot login to mercurial server

fields.description:
I installed sourcetree shortly after getting my new laptop set up. It worked the first time it ran. I have not, however, been able to get it to run since then.

When I launch it, a blank welcome screen opens but windows immediately informs me that SourceTree has stopped working.

I have tried to uninstall/reinstall. I've also deleted the %USER%\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree.exe_xxxxxxx folder per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1061 and https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1103 but this has not fixed the problem for me.

When I try to run it, I get three errors each time in the Windows Logs->Application:
.NET Runtime, Application Error, and WMI
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when starting.

fields.description:
hi

We are paid Stash users, and love this tool with its high integrated to support Stash.

But we cannot use this tool during our production environment. It seems when building a project with sourceTree GUI opened, the whole Windows OS become extremely slow and lagged to further response any actions( I called this as the "disaster"). Once this happen, I had been patient to see if the situation could recover. with almost 10 minutes passed, the computer was still not responding to me. (normally an expecting time for an incremental build would last for 10~ seconds.) Then I had to reset my laptop by pushing power buttom for 6 seconds, with tears.....)

Our environment is mingw32 with some private C compiler from silicon vendor.

Several clues:
1. this only happen when sourceTree GUI was opened in background. 
2. during the disaster, the hard disk access indicator (the LED on my laptop) always kept lighting.  
3. the app (and other app windows actions) are so slow, that I cannot close sourcetree or switch to windows task manager to watch(or kill) any other suspected processes.
4. the git repository have added .gitignore witih well defined policy that all built files have been ignored. 
5. I disabled "Refresh automatically when files change" in sourceTree according to SRCTREEWIN-760. but this issue is still randomly appeared with a frequency one per dozens builds. or say, I can meet this issue everyday with sourcetree.
6. this issue appreared since v1.0.x

I understand I reported some  issue with unclear description. Could you please advice if any actions that I could take?

Regards,
Alan
fields.summary: All windows responses extremely slow when building source

fields.description:
Take a look at GitHub diff tool (e.g. here https://github.com/inTagger/SharpTL/commit/7a0330a983c03356b5eaeb7b486fa16a431b1ced)
when it is only one line was changed, exact change is highlighted.
fields.summary: Highlight what exactly was changed on a line in the diff area.

fields.description:
Clone issue of: SRCTREEWIN-1196
I had this issue before, but then it stopped for the most part after 1.3.2. However I have just experienced the issue again when collapsing the Tags section of the tree.

See attachment for log, although it looks like the issue is in some .NET code so good luck :)
fields.summary: Application Crash when Collapse Some Tree Items

fields.description:
Seen this a few times, where Sourcetree doesn't refresh.   Restart sorts it out usually.   This time however, a sed.exe.stackdump file was showing as a new file in my project directory.   This may or may not be related to the first issue.

      0 [main] sed 5944 open_stackdumpfile: Dumping stack trace to sed.exe.stackdump

fields.description:
Crazy difficult to track down the cause (really my fault).

I helped some developers new to Stash and SourceTree setup their environment and get access to a repo in my profile for doing exercises.  Unfortunately I did this using my own username password credentials.

A week ago I had to change my passwords.  Immediately I then would have to reenter the CAPTCHA in Stash every few minutes to continue working in SourceTree.  Finally figured out that in just the browser on logout/login I would have to reenter the CAPTCHA every few minutes as well.

Those machines I had used my credentials on were still polling using those credentials causing the CAPTCHA flag to get thrown on my account in Stash.  The developers using those machines were unaware that this was even going on since they were not prompted for the failed password.

This literally took tracking IP numbers from the Stash log to the individual developer machines to figure out what had happened.  After about 5 other possible resolutions.  Ouch.

Would be awesome if you could make it prompt for the password on background login attempts.  *Thanks!*
fields.summary: Background Login Not Prompting on Failure?
